name: Countries in which same-sex sexual acts are legal – OWID based on Kenny & Patel (2017) and Carroll & Mendos (2017)
title: Countries in which same-sex sexual acts are legal – OWID based on Kenny & Patel (2017) and Carroll & Mendos (2017)
description: Data based on Figure 2 in Kenny, C., & Patel, D. (2017). Norms and Reform: Legalizing Homosexuality Improves Attitudes. Center for Global Development Working Paper, (465). Data originally collected by Carroll, A. and Mendos, L. R. (2017). State-sponsored homophobia: A world survey of sexual orientation laws criminalisation, protection and recognition. International Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Trans and Intersex Association, 12. We updated the classification for those countries where same-sex sexual activity was decriminalized in 2018 and 2019, namely: Angola (2019), Botswana (2019), Micronesia (2018), India (2018) and Trinidad & Tobago (2018).

fields.name: Number of countries where same-sex sexual acts are legal
fields.description: Countries where same-sex sexual acts are not considered a criminal offense. Some countries never contained a criminalizing provision in their Penal Codes, while others consciously removed the criminalizing provisions.

fields.name: Number of countries where same-sex sexual acts are illegal
fields.description: Countries where same-sex sexual acts are considered a criminal offense.
